message.content: This question requires knowledge about the phenomenon of snowfall in the northern hemisphere. When frozen rainfall, or snow, falls in the northern hemisphere, it covers the ground in a white carpet. This happens because snow is made up of ice crystals that reflect light, giving it a white appearance. Option (A) is incorrect because snow is not naturally grey. Option (B) is incorrect because leaves would not be falling during a snowfall. Option (D) is incorrect because snow is not off-white in color.

Option (B) is incorrect because it refers to falling leaves, which are not related to frozen rainfall. Option (D) is incorrect because off white is not the typical color of snow.
